title: Telecom Adverts, Telecom Networks, Telecom Australia'
Explanation and Rationality in the Social Sciences

A very comprehensive treatment of the topic. The authors' main argument is that naive empiricism (that is, the belief that facts are facts and we find them) is wrong because all 'facts' are interpretive claims based in political and/or social circumstances
Sophies World: A Novel about the History of Philosophy

note: The plot is excellent, and the philosophy 'lessons' are not bad either.
title: A story about a teenage girl who is drawn into a mystery that involves an unseen philosophy teacher who sends her short commentaries on philosophy
Reason and Culture
A broad-brush history of the development of modern 'Reason', pointing to the ways in which knowledge and knowledge systems
The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
A revolutionary book in itself. It argues for the centrality of non-objective theoretical paradigms and for the cultural practices of scientists in determining 'facts'
The Man of Reason

note: men in charge) has influenced the 'objective' ideas of philosophy.
title: Much Western philosophy (the basis of this book) is gender-biased, both in its practical exclusion of women and also in its founding ideas. Lloyd gives a very readable account of the ways in which the social context of patriarchy
Knowledge as Culture: The New Sociology ofKnowledge
Critical Thinking: A Concise Guide
Alternative book to the larger reasoning textbooks listed below: good concise explanations and advice

note: which I deploy in chapters 8 and 9.
title: Asking the Right Questions: A Guide to Critical Thinking, Prentice-Hall
An excellent book that organises its ideas around the key concept of analytical questioning
Critical Reasoning
A large reasoning textbook that contains an excellent discussion of the problems and advantages of relying on experts and authorities
Another textbook with a particularly good chapter on explanations and on causal reasoning
A Constructive Approach to Critical Thinking

note: Its advice on writing good arguments is particularly helpful.
title: This book was, in part, responsible for my emphasis on writing arguments and explanations, rather than analysing them
Reasoning and Communication: Thinking Critically about Arguments

note: a new edition was published in 1998.
title: A shorter work, with less emphasis on methods (such as casting). It is particularly useful for its discussion of the contexts in which argumentation takes place
Reflections On Reasoning
This book provides some very revealing insights into the processes of teaching and learning the skills of reasoning
Invitation to Critical Thinking
Contains an excellent section on casting and a comprehensive discussion of the generic errors that people make in reasoning
Beyond Feelings: A Guide to Critical Thinking

A much republished book that provides simple, common-sense advice on many issues related to reasoning; it also provides an excellent example of how the failure to consider contextual issues can render much of this advice impractical
The Art of Thinking: A Guide to Critical and Creative Thought, Pearson Longman, 2000

More up-to-date work by Ruggiero that expands on the original guide in a more 'textbook' manner. Of value is the focus the author places on personal change and commitment to critical thinking, instead of simple technique
Advocacy and Opposition: An Introduction to Argumentation
This work gives considerable advice on the process of proving particular types of conclusions and inspired my approach in chapter 8
The Uses of Argument
Most recent book by Toulmin, one of the most influential analysts of critical thinking and argumentation
An Introduction to Reasoning
An excellent, thorough critical thinking textbook, with a particular emphasis on the different ways in which premises and premise-like statements combine to
Making the Grade
Wide-ranging and up-to-date advice on study skills, including assistance with writing and communicating
You Can Write: A Do-it-YourselfManual
Excellent advice on writing and the use of plans; still useful twenty years after publication because of its clear tone and style

container-title: Communication Skills Handbook: How to Succeed in Written and Oral Communication

title: Covers many different aspects of communication, with a particular emphasis on business communication
